quiz1.title: Basic Shapes
quiz1.description: Learn about triangles, circles, and more

q1.text: What is the formula for the area of a circle?
q1.explanation: The area of a circle is calculated using the formula A = πr², where r is the radius of the circle.

science.name: Science
science.description: Explore the natural world through physics, chemistry, and biology

quiz1.title: Newton's Laws
quiz1.description: Test your understanding of Newton's Laws of Motion

q1.text: Which of Newton's laws states that an object at rest remains at rest unless acted upon by a force?
q1.explanation: Newton's First Law of Motion states that an object at rest stays at rest and an object in motion stays in motion with the same speed and in the same direction unless acted upon by an unbalanced force.

chemistry.name: Chemistry
chemistry.description: Study the composition and properties of matter

quiz1.title: Elements and Compounds
quiz1.description: Learn about elements, compounds, and mixtures

q1.text: Which of the following is a pure substance?
q1.explanation: Distilled water is a pure substance because it consists of only water molecules (H₂O). The other options are mixtures.

programming.name: Programming
programming.description: Learn how to code in various programming languages

quiz1.title: Java Basics
quiz1.description: Test your knowledge of Java fundamentals

q1.text: Which of the following is the correct way to declare a main method in Java?
q1.explanation: The correct declaration is 'public static void main(String[] args)'. It must be public to be accessible, static to be called without creating an instance, and must accept a String array parameter.

q2.text: What is the output of System.out.println(5 + 3 + "Hello")?
q2.explanation: Java evaluates expressions from left to right. First, 5 + 3 is evaluated to 8, then 8 is concatenated with the string "Hello" to produce "8Hello".

kotlin.name: Kotlin
kotlin.description: Master the Kotlin programming language for Android

quiz1.title: Kotlin Fundamentals
quiz1.description: Check your understanding of Kotlin basics

q1.text: Which keyword is used to declare a variable that can be reassigned in Kotlin?
q1.explanation: In Kotlin, 'var' is used to declare mutable variables that can be reassigned, while 'val' is used for read-only variables (similar to final in Java).

q2.text: What is the correct way to check for nullability in Kotlin?
q2.explanation: Kotlin provides multiple ways to handle null safety: traditional null checks (if (object != null)), the safe call operator (object?.), and scope functions like let (object?.let { ... }).
